author: Alessio Amoruso
title: Google Pixel Tablet 3 potrebbe non arrivare mai
text:
Il debutto del Pixel Tablet 2 √® previsto nel corso del 2025 a circa due anni di distanza dal lancio dall‚Äôultimo device della serie. Nonostante il tablet non sia ancora arrivato ufficialmente, sono gi√† in circolazione alcune voci riguardanti il suo successore.
Nonostante Google presenter√† il nuovo tablet il prossimo anno, gli analisti credevano che una nuova generazione avrebbe permesso di dare vita ad una serie fiorente. Tuttavia, i nuovi report emersi indicano [che Google](https://www.tecnoandroid.it/2024/11/20/oneplus-pad-2-il-primo-tablet-con-android-15-fuori-dalla-famiglia-pixel-1480117/) potrebbe bloccare lo sviluppo del presunto Pixel Tablet 3.
Stando a quanto anticipato dai colleghi di [Android Headlines](https://www.androidheadlines.com/exclusive-google-cancels-pixel-tablet-3-development), il presunto Pixel Tablet 3 era gi√† in fase di sviluppo presso gli uffici di Mountain View. Il device era conosciuto internamente con il nome ‚ÄúKiyomi‚Äù.
Google potrebbe uscire definitivamente dal mercato dei tablet, l‚Äôazienda ha sospeso i lavori sul Pixel Tablet 3
La fonte, rimasta anonima, ha affermato che Google avrebbe avvisato i team interni dedicati allo sviluppo del Pixel Tablet 3 della chiusura del progetto. La notizia risale alla scorsa settimana e i dipendenti sono stati riassegnati ad altri progetti.
Se questa notizia dovesse essere confermata, potrebbe trattarsi dell‚Äôaddio definitivo di Google al settore tablet. Le motivazioni di questa scelta non sono chiare ma non √® la prima volta che l‚Äôazienda del robottino verde abbandona questo mercato. Il precedente risale a quando la linea di dispositivi realizzata da [Mountain View](https://www.tecnoandroid.it/2024/11/21/google-chat-continua-a-evolversi-con-i-messaggi-vocali-alla-portata-di-tutti-1480660/) si chiamava Nexus.
Si tratta di una scelta in controtendenza rispetto ai principali competitor che ancora credono nel mercato dei tablet Android. Infatti, produttori del calibro di Samsung, Xiaomi, [Oppo](https://www.tecnoandroid.it/2024/11/20/oppo-pad-3-scopriamo-le-caratteristiche-del-tablet-prima-del-lancio-ufficiale-1480059/) e [OnePlus](https://www.tecnoandroid.it/2024/11/20/oneplus-in-arrivo-un-tablet-da-13-pollici-1480058/) presentano device con costanza e si stanno preparando a presentare nuovi dispositivi.
Purtroppo, al momento non √® chiaro se si tratti di una notizia reale o solo una delle tante voci. Nonostante le fonti riportate siano state indicate come vicine all‚Äôazienda, resta il dubbio considerando anche che il Pixel Tabet 2 non √® stato annunciato ufficialmente.

author: Cristian Neira
title: Macabro hallazgo en Franja de Gaza: Encuentran varias fosas comunes en un hospital
text:
[Internacional](/internacional)
Son casi 400 cuerpos, algunos con se√±ales de tortura, los que se encontraron en varias fosas comunes en el hospital Naser de Jan Yunis de la Franja de Gaza, lo que aumenta el estupor mundial por los bombardeos de Israel.
Los equipos de rescate de la defensa civil de la Franja de Gaza han recuperado ya 392 cad√°veres de varias fosas comunes en el hospital Naser de Jan Yunis, en el sur del enclave, recoge la agencia oficial de noticias palestina, Wafa, algunos con signos de tortura.
La mayor√≠a de los cad√°veres todav√≠a no han sido identificados, seg√∫n las autoridades, que organizaron este jueves una rueda de prensa para compartir los √∫ltimos datos sobre las exhumaciones.
Adem√°s, entre los cuerpos habr√≠a una veintena con indicios de haber sido enterrados vivos, seg√∫n inform√≥ hoy la cadena catar√≠ Al Yazira, presente en la rueda de prensa.
¬´Cualquier intento de culpar a Israel de enterrar a civiles en fosas comunes es categ√≥ricamente falso y un mero ejemplo de una campa√±a de desinformaci√≥n dirigida a deslegitimar a Israel¬ª, dijo el portavoz militar, Nadav Shoshani en un comunicado.
El Ej√©rcito israel√≠ s√≠ ha admitido ¬´examinar¬ª cuerpos enterrados en los patios del hospital Naser en b√∫squeda de posibles rehenes israel√≠es muertos. Durante el asedio israel√≠ de este hospital, personal m√©dico y pacientes se vieron forzados a enterrar a algunos fallecidos en los patios, al no poder abandonar la instalaci√≥n por miedo a la artiller√≠a israel√≠.
Pero entre los centenares de cad√°veres hallados hay ni√±os, mujeres y tambi√©n cad√°veres con las manos atadas y sondas todav√≠a ligadas a sus cuerpos.
Las escenas recuerdan a lo sucedido en el hospital Al Shifa, el m√°s importante de la Franja ubicado en el norte del enclave, que qued√≥ totalmente fuera de servicio tras un asedio israel√≠ de dos semanas a finales de marzo.
Tras la salida de las tropas israel√≠es el 1 de abril, las autoridades gazat√≠es descubrieron una fosa com√∫n con una decena de cuerpos enterrados, entre los que hab√≠a pacientes, mujeres y ancianos.
En total, se recuperaron unos 400 cuerpos dentro del per√≠metro del hospital y alrededores en los d√≠as posteriores a la salida de las tropas.
El Ej√©rcito israel√≠ se retir√≥ de Jan Yunis durante la madrugada del 7 de abril, tras cuatro meses de combates y bombardeos en esta zona, tambi√©n contra viviendas y poblaci√≥n civil en los que murieron familias enteras gazat√≠es.

author: @Live5News
title: Man celebrates last day of work after 48 years at supermarket chain
text: Man celebrates last day of work after 48 years at supermarket chain WEST DES MOINES, Iowa (KCCI) - For an Iowa man, the start of 2024 will bring a lot of change to his normal routine as he retires from supermarket chain Hy-Vee after almost five decades. It‚Äôs not every day Steve Mick gets chauffeured around, but after 48 years at Hy-Vee, Sunday was his last day and his boss insisted on the special ride to work. Outside the West Des Moines supermarket was a display celebrating Mick‚Äôs years of service. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs amazing,‚Äù Mick said. ‚ÄúWow. It‚Äôs about all I can say.‚Äù Inside the store, countless hugs and congratulations from family, friends and former colleagues showed the impact Mick had on the community. He started at Hy-Vee behind the meat counter in 1975 when he was just 16. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs the same person today: extremely nice, extremely thoughtful, willing to help the customers,‚Äù longtime colleague Marilyn Cook said. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs been such a hard worker all his life, and today is kind of a bittersweet day for all of us,‚Äù said Mick‚Äôs daughter, Kerri Driscoll. Mick worked at different Hy-Vee locations throughout his career, his last being the store in West Des Moines on Jordan Creek Parkway. ‚ÄúIt was just a place that fit for me,‚Äù Mick said. ‚ÄúBeen a long haul, and it‚Äôs been well worth it.‚Äù As the chapter at Hy-Vee comes to an end, the cake at Mick‚Äôs party is a hint as to what part of retirement looks like: camping and time in nature with family. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm going to let life happen to me, enjoy every minute of it,‚Äù Mick said. Mick‚Äôs co-workers say he will be missed after bringing smiles to people during his nearly five decades on the job. Copyright 2024 KCCI via CNN Newsource. All rights reserved.

author: Vivian Jones
title: Trump vows to support Christianity if he tops Biden in 2024 election
text: Vivian Jones Former President Donald Trump called on Christians to support his presidential bid, pledging if elected to "protect God in the public square," defend Christian broadcasters and their "pro-God" content from censorship, and appoint a task force to fight anti-Christian bias, including federal prosecutions. Trump spoke to an enthusiastic crowd of about 1,500 Thursday evening at a presidential forum at the annual conference of the National Religious Broadcasters at the Gaylord Opryland Resort and Convention Center in Nashville. The [nonprofit‚Äôs annual convention is in Music City this week](/story/news/religion/2024/02/22/national-religous-broadcasters-media-summit-defending-faith-in-public-donald-trump-speech/72687839007/). Many in the crowd wore red and white hats with the phrase ‚ÄúMake America Pray Again,‚Äù provided by conference sponsor Pray.com, as wild cheers broke out to welcome the former president. ‚ÄúI really believe it‚Äôs the biggest thing missing from this country, the biggest thing. We have to bring back our religion. We have to bring back Christianity,‚Äù Trump said, prompting a big cheer from the crowd. Despite a tight calendar of court appearances and campaigning, Trump appeared in Nashville with just two days to go before the South Carolina primary. The former president is the frontrunner against former South Carolina Gov. Nikki Haley in her home state ‚Äì as he is here in Tennessee. Voters here in the Volunteer State will cast ballots on Super Tuesday on March 5. Early voting is already underway. Prep for the polls: See who is running for president and compare where they stand on key issues in our Voter Guide NRB President Troy Miller said the organization invited all eligible candidates from both parties to participate in the presidential forum, and Trump was the only candidate who was available to attend. The NRB has not endorsed Trump‚Äôs presidential bid. Lines for the presidential forum already snaked through the Opryland hotel lobby just after 3 p.m. But Trump, who was scheduled to take the stage around 8 p.m. CT, kept the hyped crowd waiting. The room was far from packed. At about 8:40 p.m., nearly an hour before Trump took the stage, staff urgently began removing hundreds of chairs from the back corner of the room. About 200 empty seats on the far side of the room remained. Before Trump walked on stage, the crowd stood in recognition of ‚Äúthe January 6th hostages," referring to those who face federal charges for their role in storming the U.S. Capitol. His speech began at 9:42 p.m. and wrapped shortly before 11 p.m. During his opening comments, Trump blamed the delay on rough weather during his flight. 'We will protect God in our public square' Trump asked the crowd of Christian broadcasters and media to support his bid for the White House, pledging to defend Christians from domestic persecution, censorship, and infringements on their rights. He denounced the [recent convictions of six anti-abortion protesters arrested in 2021 for blockading the entrance to a Mt. Juliet reproductive health clinic where abortions are performed](/story/news/crime/2024/01/30/anti-abortion-protesters-felony-convictions-nashville-blockade/72397522007/). The group is facing up to 10.5 years in prison and fines of more than a quarter-million dollars for their actions. ‚ÄúLet‚Äôs call these brave Americans what they really are: persecuted Christians,‚Äù Trump said. Meanwhile, Trump accused the Biden administration of ‚Äútargeting Christian believers‚Äù and pledged, if elected again, to appoint a special task force ‚Äúto rapidly review the cases of every political prisoner." ‚ÄúRemember, every communist regime throughout history has tried to stamp out the churches ‚Äì just like every fascist regime is trying to go up and control them,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúIn America, the radical left is trying to do both at the same time.‚Äù Trump pledged to establish a new federal task force on ‚Äúfighting anti-Christian bias.‚Äù ‚ÄúIts mission will be to investigate all forms of illegal discrimination, harassment and persecution against Christians in America,‚Äù Trump said. ‚ÄúNo one will be touching the cross of Christ under the Trump administration,‚Äù he added, to a big applause from the crowd. Trump also claimed without evidence that religious broadcasters are ‚Äúunder siege,‚Äù pledging if elected to ‚Äúprotect content that is pro-God.‚Äù ‚ÄúWe will protect God in our public square," Trump said. "I will not allow the media or left-wing groups silence you, censor you, discriminate against you, or in any way tell you what you have to say." Trump briefly mentioned his multiple criminal indictments, claiming them as political persecution. ‚ÄúI take all these arrows for you and I‚Äôm so proud to take them,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm being indicted for you,‚Äù outstretching his arms as if on a cross. He touted efforts to support Israel during his presidency, citing his administration‚Äôs move to relocate the U.S. Embassy to Jerusalem ‚Äì and pledged to ‚Äústand strongly‚Äù with Israel ‚Äì prompting a standing ovation from much of the crowd. During his speech, Trump invited former U.S. Ambassador to Israel David Friedman up on stage to provide remarks. Friedman, who wore a medallion around his neck to remember the more than 100 Israeli hostages still in Hamas captivity, told Trump that the Oct. 7 attack on southern Israel ‚Äúwould not have happened,‚Äù had Trump still been in office. The crowd stood cheering several times as Trump rolled through a list of other priorities, including expanding school choice options, abolishing the U. S. Department of Education, securing the southern U.S. border with Mexico, defeating the ‚Äútoxic force of gender ideology,‚Äù keeping ‚Äúmen out of women‚Äôs sports,‚Äù and ‚Äúprohibiting child mutilation in all 50 states.‚Äù ‚ÄúIn the end, we do not answer to bureaucrats in Washington, we answer to God in heaven,‚Äù Trump said. ‚ÄòHe‚Äôs one of us‚Äô Those attending were overwhelmingly supportive of the former president, and [ much of the conference carried similar themes as his speech.](/story/news/religion/2024/02/22/national-religous-broadcasters-media-summit-defending-faith-in-public-donald-trump-speech/72687839007/) Washington state resident Fritz Von Tagen traveled to Nashville for the NRB conference to exhibit his company, which develops backgrounds for virtual reality television. Von Tagen, who was wearing a red MAGA hat and an Israeli flag lapel pin, said he hopes Trump is reelected for the sake of small business owners, like himself. ‚ÄúI want to hear his plan to put our country back together. We‚Äôre hurting badly,‚Äù Von Tagen told The Tennessean. ‚ÄúOur company really started growing until this last administration. It‚Äôs doing well, but not near as well as it would normally.‚Äù ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs a lot more people working now that know nothing about the English language. They can‚Äôt speak English," Von Tagen added. "I feel bad that all those illegal people are taking jobs away from the Americans.‚Äù Jim Sheldon, of Kentucky, whose company is also exhibiting at NRB, said he was looking forward to hearing directly from the former president with ‚Äúno spin.‚Äù ‚ÄúTrump is just, I think, one of us, really,‚Äù Sheldon said. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs a billionaire, but he‚Äôs one of us.‚Äù Vivian Jones covers state politics and government for The Tennessean. Reach her at vjones@tennessean.com.

author: VNExplorer
title: Le Pen win could threaten Britain's financial stability, BoE warns
text: Party is on course to win the election after victory in European parliament poll The French election poses a threat to Britain‚Äôs financial stability if Emmanuel Macron loses to Marie Le Pen, the Bank of England has warned. The National Rally is on course to win the snap vote called by President Macron after the hard-Right party‚Äôs crushing victory in European parliament elections last month. Bond markets ‚Äî which lend to governments ‚Äî are closely analysing the polls in France as well as in Britain and the United States, with some politicians making big spending promises despite high debt levels. The Bank cited the issue in its latest Financial Stability Report. ‚ÄòPolicy uncertainty associated with upcoming elections globally has increased,‚Äô it said. ‚ÄòThis could make the global economic outlook less certain and lead to financial market volatility. Marine Le-Pen's party could pose a threat to Britain's economy if her party wins the French snap elections, the Bank of England has warned ‚ÄòIt could also increase existing sovereign debt pressures, geopolitical risks, and risks associated with global fragmentation, all of which are relevant to UK financial stability.‚Äô The Bank said such factors could ‚Äòmake the economic outlook less certain and could lead to market volatility... as already observed in response to the unexpected news of French parliamentary elections over the summer‚Äô. The Bank made clear that worries about public finances abroad could be brought home to the UK. ‚ÄòHigh public debt levels in major economies could have consequences for UK financial stability and interact with other risks,‚Äô the Bank said. That could happen if bond investors‚Äô worries about public debt spread across the world. Aside from Macron's election, the Bank said that other factors such as developments in the Middle East, Russia's war in Ukraine and US-China relations all represent 'sources of material geopolitical risks' Households and businesses could then find it harder to borrow and government borrowing costs could rise, making it harder to find the money to respond to future shocks. Meanwhile, threats posed by conflict in the Middle East, Russia‚Äôs war in Ukraine and US-China relations all represent ‚Äòsources of material geopolitical risks‚Äô. ‚ÄòFor example, developments in the Middle East, including disruption to shipping through the Red Sea, or further escalation of conflict in Ukraine, could disrupt global trade and supply chains and cause sharp moves in commodity prices,‚Äô the Bank said. Such moves could trigger a range of consequences such as higher inflation and interest rates or market turbulence. Read more

author: Devdiscourse News Desk
title: Cyber Deception Hits West Bengal Students in Tablet Scheme | Law-Order
text: Cyber Deception Hits West Bengal Students in Tablet Scheme A cyber fraud targeting the 'Taruner Swapno' scheme in West Bengal affected 1,911 students. The scheme offers Rs 10,000 for tablets to Class 10 and 12 students. Police have filed 93 cases and arrested 11 suspects. The fraud involves interstate gangs from Maharashtra, Rajasthan, and Jharkhand. - Country: - India A cyber fraud targeting the 'Taruner Swapno' scheme has victimized 1,911 of the 16 lakh students in West Bengal. The scheme, designed to provide Rs 10,000 to students for purchasing tablets, has instead become a target for cybercriminals. In response, West Bengal police have launched a thorough investigation, filing 93 FIRs and arresting 11 individuals connected to the fraudulent activities. Senior officials revealed that these crimes involved cybercriminals from across Maharashtra, Rajasthan, and Jharkhand, operating as organized interstate gangs. Special Investigation Teams (SITs) have been established to delve deeper, exploring possible manipulation of the system or internal collusion at different levels. Authorities are collaborating with law enforcement in other states to comprehensively tackle this cyber fraud epidemic. (With inputs from agencies.)

title: Former SC judge Maheshwari appointed 23rd law panel chair
text:
Former SC judge Maheshwari appointed 23rd law panel chair
NEW DELHI: The Centre on Tuesday appointed former SC judge,
The 23rd law commission, which was notified on Sept 2 last year, has a tenure of three years, till Aug 2027. It has provision for a chairman, four full-time members, including member secretary, two secretaries of
The 22nd Law Commission was headed by Justice Ritu Raj Awasthi, who demitted office before completing his tenure as he was appointed as member of the Lokpal. During his term, the panel had conducted consultation on UCC. Using AI, it analysed over 80 lakh petitions received from the public.
Justice Dinesh Maheshwari, as chairman of the 23rd Law Commission. The terms of reference of the panel includes submitting a report on UCC, a study on laws affecting poor, and identifying laws that are hindrance to India's economic growth.
The 23rd law commission, which was notified on Sept 2 last year, has a tenure of three years, till Aug 2027. It has provision for a chairman, four full-time members, including member secretary, two secretaries of
law ministryand not more than five part time members. Justice Maheshwari retired from the apex court in May 2023.
The 22nd Law Commission was headed by Justice Ritu Raj Awasthi, who demitted office before completing his tenure as he was appointed as member of the Lokpal. During his term, the panel had conducted consultation on UCC. Using AI, it analysed over 80 lakh petitions received from the public.
